content:
Carla is downloading a 200 GB file. Normally she can download 2 GB/minute, but 40% of the way through the download, Windows forces a restart to install updates, which takes 20 minutes. Then Carla has to restart the download from the beginning. How load does it take to download the file?
Now please strictly answer this question in the json format: "{"reasons": "(a string of your reasoning process)", "answer": "(a pure numeric value without unit)"}"

{"reasons": "Carla can download 2 GB/minute. The download is interrupted 40% of the way through and takes 20 minutes to restart. Therefore, Carla has to download 60% of the file again. The remaining file size is 200 GB * 60% = 120 GB. It takes 120 GB / 2 GB/minute = 60 minutes to download the remaining file.", "answer": "60"}

There are 2 groups of people discussing on the same math word question. I will provide you the detailed reasons and answers from your group member and answers from other group members. Use these opinions and your previous answer as additional advice, note that they maybe wrong. Do not copy other's entire answer, modify the part you believe is wrong.

Other group members' opinions:
Two agents think the answer is 80.
One agent thinks the answer is 60.

Your group's opinions:
One agent thinks the answer is 200. Below is his response:
{"reasons": "Carla can download 2 GB/minute. The download is interrupted 40% of the way through and Carla has to restart from the beginning. The interruption takes 20 minutes. Therefore, Carla has to download 60% of the file after the interruption. The total time taken will be the time taken to download 40% of the file before the interruption plus the time taken to download 60% of the file after the interruption.", "answer": "200"}

One agent thinks the answer is 80. Below is his response:
{"reasons": "Carla can download 2 GB/minute. The download is interrupted at 40% and Carla has to restart from the beginning. The interrupted download is 40% of 200 GB, which is 80 GB. Carla needs to download the remaining 120 GB after the interruption. The time it takes to download 120 GB at a rate of 2 GB/minute is 60 minutes. The interruption time of 20 minutes needs to be added to the download time, so the total time it takes to download the file is 80 minutes.", "answer": "80"}

{"reasons": "Carla can download 2 GB/minute. The download is interrupted 40% of the way through and takes 20 minutes to restart. Therefore, Carla has to download 60% of the file again. The remaining file size is 200 GB * 60% = 120 GB. It takes 120 GB / 2 GB/minute = 60 minutes to download the remaining file. The interruption time of 20 minutes needs to be added to the download time, so the total time it takes to download the file is 60 + 20 = 80 minutes.", "answer": "80"}
